United Arab Emirates (UAE)-based doctor and philanthropist Dr Shamsheer Vayalil has announced a financial aid of a total of Rs 6 crore to the families of the medical students who died or sustained injuries after an Air India plane crashed into the BJ Medical College hostels on June 12.
The relief package includes Rs 1 crore aid to the families of each of the four deceased students, Rs 20 lakh each to five seriously injured students, and Rs 20 lakh each for the families of doctors who lost their loved ones in the crash.
The London-bound plane crashed shortly after take-off from the Ahmedabad airport and the incident not only claimed the lives of 242 passengers and crew members on board, but also eight more present at the hostel the aircraft crashed into. Dozens of others present at hostel in Meghaninagar were also injured in the incident.
The deceased medical students have been identified as Rakesh Diyora, Aryan Rajput, Manav Bhadoo, and Jay Prakash Chaudhary. Family members of doctors were also killed.
reference_summary: UAE-based doctor and philanthropist Dr. Shamsheer Vayalil announced a ₹6 crore relief package for victims of the Air India crash that struck BJ Medical College hostels on June 12. The aid includes ₹1 crore each to the families of four deceased medical students, ₹20 lakh each to five seriously injured students, and ₹20 lakh for families of doctors who lost loved ones. The London-bound flight crashed shortly after take-off from Ahmedabad, killing 242 people on board and eight at the hostel. The deceased students were Rakesh Diyora, Aryan Rajput, Manav Bhadoo, and Jay Prakash Chaudhary.

[DOC 1] bangalore: it is a myth that technology itself improves the quality of life. only if such technology is made available to the majority and used imaginatively for the well-being of society can people appreciate its importance, azim premji, chairman of azim premji foundation said here on wednesday. delivering the keynote address at a consultative workshop on role of technology in elementary education organised by the azim premji foundation, he said there was a growing demand by parents that children should learn english language and computers. the human development report 2001 has established that there is a direct correlation between the technology achievement index and the human development index of the country. speaking on the role of it in elementary education as one of the key facilitators in achieving universalisation of elementary education, premji said: ``there is a huge potential to impact the quality of learning through imaginative usage of education contests that can effectively supplement the efforts of teachers. there is a need to develop education software content with a context base which is indian and rural,'' he said. eductionists should give due importance to the aspirations of vast majority of parents as well as the demands and expecations of children while evolving a perspective on elementary education. ``we also need to be aware of the demands that would emerge ten years later in terms of employment competencies and societal pressure of utilising it in every walk of life. very clearly, the definition of literacy would change to include it literacy,'' premji told the gathering which comprised officials from different states and ngos. universalisation of elementary education is not the responsibility of the government alone but all citizens. ``the task before us is mammoth and there is no way we can achieve this task without the active participation and cooperation of not only the government but every member of the society,'' he said. the apf was committed to facilitate the process of universalisation of elementary education in a rime bound and result oriented manner. ``for this, we are willing to commit resources to supplement the efforts of the government and
other agencies,'' premji explained. making a presentation on the community learning centre initiative, apf executive group member c.v. madhukar said a pilot project was being carried out on the effective use of it infurthering elementary education. the project was being carried out in 34 community learning centres set up by the apf.
reference_summary: Azim Premji, Chairman of Azim Premji Foundation, addressed a workshop on the role of technology in elementary education in Bangalore. Premji emphasized that technology's impact on quality of life lies in its imaginative use for societal well-being and universal access. He highlighted the growing demand for English and computer education. Acknowledging the correlation between the technology achievement index and human development index, he stressed the need for Indian and rural-centric educational software. Premji urged educationists to consider parental aspirations and evolving employment competencies. Emphasizing collective responsibility for universalizing elementary education, he pledged the foundation's support and presented a pilot project on IT's role in education.

[DOC 1] MUMBAI: A sessions court convicted a taxi driver for molestation and sentenced him to a year in jail, after medical evidence proved inconclusive in
showing that he had raped a nine-year-old girl.
Rameshwar Kohli (40) was booked by the police for rape under Section 376 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC). But after medical evidence failed to provide
sufficient proof, judge S M Bhumkar convicted him for 'outraging the modesty of a woman' under Section 354 of the IPC.
The complainant in the case was the victim's aunt, Pushpa, who told the police that she had hired Kohli's taxi on June 8, 2003 at Dharavi to go to Wadala.
She said in the FIR that Kohli took them to a road near Bombay Port Trust Hospital and raped the girl, while Pushpa could do nothing to protest.
According to the procedure, the police sent the girl for a medical test but a team of three doctors from Sion Hospital said that there wasn't enough
evidence to conclude that the victim had been raped. He was therefore sentenced to only a year and was fined Rs 2,000.
In a similar case that was wrapped up in a sessions court earlier this month, a driver was sentenced to ten years in jail on charges of having 'unnatural
intercourse' with a ten-month-old child, after medical evidence failed to show that she had been raped. In this case, the judge could rely on injuries
suffered by the child to hand out a stiff sentence.
reference_summary: A taxi driver, Raseshwar Kohli, was convicted of molestation and sentenced to a year in jail after medical evidence failed to prove he had raped a nine-year-old girl. The victim's aunt, Pushpa, claimed Kohli took them to a road near Bombay Port Trust Hospital and raped the girl. The police sent the girl for a medical test, but doctors found insufficient evidence. Kohli was fined Rs 2,000. Similar cases have been heard in a sessions court.

[DOC 1] One teacher and over 20 students sustained injuries when some candidates appearing in HSLC Exam 2020 raised an uproar and vandalised Lilong Higher Secondary Madrassa (exam centre) today.
Students/candidates of six schools of Lilong gave the HSLC Exam at the centre.
As soon as the last bell of today’s examination was rung, students giving the exam on the first floor of the school suddenly threw down desks, benches and white boards in addition to smashing windows and doors of some classrooms.
The students then ran down and damaged vehicles of teachers and BSEM officials parked inside the school campus by pelting stones.
The school’s Economics teacher RK Milan and over 20 students sustained injuries in the violent uproar.
Altogether two cars, two vans and four two-wheelers were also damaged although the situation was brought under control with the arrival of security forces.
Officer in-charge of the examination centre MA Quadir told media persons that the HSLC Exam which started on February 17 was going on peacefully at the exam centre.
However, some students giving the exam on the first floor of the school raised an uproar all of a sudden as soon as the last bell of today’s exam was rung, Quadir said.
He then appealed to all concerned teachers and guardians to send their students/wards to examinations only after teaching them on how to behave properly in exam centres so as to avoid such ugly incidents in future.
According to information culled from the spot, all the students were checked at the entrance gate of the school.
Later, four flying squads of BSEM too came to the exam centre. After three flying squads left, one stayed back and checked the students.
As around 30 minutes were lost due to the checking done by the flying squad, the OC assured that some grace time would be given to all the candidates.
However, the grace time was given to some classrooms while in other classrooms, the exam was concluded at the end of the scheduled time.
 This enraged some students and they revolted by vandalising the exam centre,  according to information culled from the spot.
reference_summary: During the HSLC Exam 2020 at Lilong Higher Secondary Madrassa, candidates from six schools caused a disturbance, resulting in injuries to one teacher and over 20 students. After the exam ended, students on the first floor threw down furniture, damaged property, and attacked vehicles belonging to teachers and BSEM officials. Security forces intervened to control the situation. The examination had been proceeding peacefully until the disturbance occurred. The officer in-charge of the exam center urged teachers and guardians to educate students on proper behavior in exam centers to prevent such incidents in the future. The disruption was reportedly triggered by some students being upset over the examination schedule and the conduct of the flying squads, which led to some students not receiving a grace period for the exam.

[DOC 1] North Korea said Monday that “reckless remarks” by US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo made it clear that Washington has no intention of resuming nuclear talks, and warned that it is now compelled to pay back “the pains the US has imposed on our people.”

After a teleconference of foreign ministers of the Group of Seven leading industrial nations last week, Pompeo told reporters the international community must remain united in urging North Korea to return to nuclear talks and in continuing to apply pressure on its nuclear and missile programmes.

Pompeo’s remarks showed the US. Has no strategy to stop “a countdown of confrontation,” North Korea said in a statement attributed to its new Foreign Ministry department director general in charge of negotiations with Washington.

The statement said Pompeo’s comments “seriously impaired the signboard of dialogue put up by the US president as a decoy to buy time and create the environment favorable for himself.”

It referred to a recent personal letter that President Donald Trump sent to North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, which North Korea said was aimed at maintaining good relations and offering cooperation in fighting the coronavirus pandemic.

[DOC 1] Chief Minister PS Golay has congratulated Ravindra Telang on his well-deserved promotion as the chief secretary of the Sikkim government.

“This remarkable achievement is a testament to his dedication, expertise, perseverance, and resolute commitment to the ideals of public service. During his tenure I am confident that Sikkim will scale greater heights of progress, prosperity, and innovation ensuring impactful governance. I extend my best wishes for his tremendous success in this pivotal role,” said Chief Minister in congratulatory message.

Telang, an IAS officer of 1995 batch of Sikkim cadre, replaces outgoing chief secretary VB Pathak. With Sikkim government on a weeklong festive break starting December 28, Telang is expected to formally take charge as the chief secretary when the government offices resume on January 7, 2024.

In his message, the Chief Minister thanked the outgoing chief secretary VB Pathak for his tireless efforts and invaluable contributions to the welfare of the people of Sikkim during his tenure of service. I wish him good health and every success in his endeavors and a fulfilling and congenial retired life, the Chief Minister said.

An IAS officer of 1995 batch (Sikkim cadre), Ravindra Telang started his administrative career in Sikkim as the sub-divisional magistrate in Chungthang. He went on to serve in various progressive posts including as district magistrate before heading departments as the secretary and principal secretary. He was last serving as the additional chief secretary of Home and Education departments before being promoted as the chief secretary of Sikkim.

Telang has done B.Tech from NIT Bhopal and M.Tech from IIT Kanpur. After completing his M.Tech, he started preparing for the UPSC exams. He cleared the UPSC exams in his second attempt and was selected for the IAS batch of 1995, Sikkim cadre.
reference_summary: Chief Minister PS Golay congratulated Ravindra Telang on his promotion as Sikkim's chief secretary, succeeding VB Pathak. An IAS officer of the 1995 Sikkim cadre, Telang has held key posts and served as additional chief secretary before this role. Golay praised his dedication and expressed confidence in his impactful leadership.

[DOC 1] Sonia Gandhi thinks that when Rahul Gandhi officially takes charge as the Congress president, only then will he be taken seriously against Narendra
Modi. Presently, there is more focus on Nitish Kumar and Arvind Kejriwal in comparison to Rahul. But, it is also being said that Rahul is still hesitant
Party work is continuing like routine work for Amit Shah. On January 24, he was elected for the post of the BJP president for three years and the next day, he
held a rally in West Bengal and discussed the election preparations with the State leaders. Sources of the BJP say that Amit Shah’s fate was almost decided
so he was working as per his strategy; which is why he is not making any changes in the organisation with immediate effect.
The present organisation of the BJP has been created by him. Of course, some State presidents will be changed; Bihar, UP, Jharkhand and Delhi are the
important ones. Some new faces will come into the organisation and some will join the Government. But all these will be done like routine work. It is said
that Shah has identified all the faces.
On the other hand, Prime Minister Narendra Modi has also gathered the details of work done by the Government. Modi has held meetings with the
secretaries and judged the pace of work of all the departments. Those who are not working as per expectations will be removed and will also not get any
work even in the organisation. Half a dozen ministers who are working hard may get promoted. But, Budget and elections are ahead so the party will be
busy in election and ministers will be preparing the Budget. The Government needs massive management for the Budget Session and at the same time the
organisation has to put its whole strength for the election in five States. So, we have to wait to see the changes.
KEJRIWAl AND DElHI
Congress is at loggerheads with the AAP. Congress leaders are much worried that AAP may spoil its game in Punjab. If AAP dents the vote bank of Congress,
the party will suffer losses in Himachal and Gujarat also. That is why the Congress leaders are repeatedly targeting AAP. But, when the Central Government
decided to impose President’s rule in Congress governed Arunachal Pradesh, it was the AAP which opposed it before any other opposition party. Arvind
Kejriwal stood with Congress on this issue. His party officially informed Congress that it would extend full support to it in this case in Parliament also.
It is said that Delhi is the reason behind Kejriwal’s restlessness. leaders of the AAP are apprehensive that the Central Government might dissolve the
Government in Delhi also. Recently, AAP leaders discussed this issue too. Close aides of Kejriwal think that citing reasons of instability, anarchy and the law
and order situation of Delhi, the Central Government might impose governor’s rule in Delhi. They are also apprehensive that the Central Government may
also abolish the half State status of Delhi. It means Delhi might return to the pre-1993 situation when there was no Assembly in Delhi.
RESTRUCTURING CONGRESS
Congress may face organisational changes. Rahul Gandhi has told the journalists who met him that there is no connection between his taking command of
the party and organisational changes within the party. He has indicated that there might be significant changes in the party even before he takes charge of
it. Probably, many old General Secretaries can be changed.
Reliable sources say that barring CP Joshi, BK Hariprasad and Gurudas Kamat, all the General Secretaries will not be given any other chance. leaders of the
party are saying that Rahul himself will make the changes and the caste equations will be taken care of. Sources say that in place of Mukul Wasnik, who is a
Dalit face, former IAS officer K Raju can be accommodated. He is the man who is steering the Dalit politics of the Congress.
likewise, it is said that Jitendra Singh may come in place of Digvijaya Singh and Ajay Maken may find space in place of Ambika Soni. Though Maken is the
State president of Delhi, Rahul feels that there is nothing to do in Delhi. Randeep Surjewala may also be appointed General Secretary and can be continued
as media in-charge. From women’s quota, Meenakshi Natarajan can be made the General Secretary. From UP, either RPN Singh or Jitin Prasad may be
appointed the General Secretary.
RAHUl AND HIS FORMUlA
Amidst the news of possible changes in Congress, suspense is continuing over two questions: When will Rahul become the president of Congress and will
his formula be implementedIJ Sonia Gandhi wants to hand over the command of the party to Rahul as soon as possible. She feels that when Rahul is taking
all the responsibilities of the party president, he should officially take charge as well. She believes that when he does it officially, only then will he be taken Out of these 12, eight will be from OBC, Dalit, minority and women. There will be only four General Secretaries from the general quota. Sources close to
Rahul claim that this formula will not be implemented very rigidly. It may be possible that there will be five or six General Secretaries from general quota.
At present there are three Brahmin General Secretaries, but it might reduce to two in the new committee. Dr Shakeel Ahmad may be sent to the Rajya Sabha
from Bihar so there is much speculation over a new Muslim face.
ElECTIONS BEFORE TIME IN J&KIJ
Suddenly, there is a debate over the pre-scheduled Assembly Elections in Jammu and Kashmir. Supposedly, National Conference and Congress are behind
such debates and discussions. It is said that for the last few months, BJP’s top leadership, especially Narendra Modi and Amit Shah, has not been paying
attention to the affairs of Jammu and Kashmir. Reliable sources say that the top leaders don’t want to bow down before the hard bargaining of Mehbooba
Mufti. This doesn’t send good message among the BJP supporters. That is the reason why the BJP has left all the responsibilities to former deputy CM
Nirmal Singh and party General Secretary Ram Madhav.
On the other hand, Sonia is taking special interest in the affairs of Jammu and Kashmir. Ghulam Nabi Azad is advising her. That is why she had gone to
Srinagar to condole the death of Mufti Mohammad. People are saying that NC and Congress have moulded the politics of J&K as per their own wish. These
parties have created such an atmosphere that it is sending the message that people of the Valley are miffed with PDP whereas the people of Jammu are not
happy with the BJP.
And that is the prime reason why the Peoples Democratic Party and BJP have become defensive. Sources say that both the parties don’t want election at
this stage because they fear a huge loss. But, Congress and NC have led to the speculation of a pre-schedule election. Both the parties are expecting
benefits out of this politics. Sources say that both the parties are working on the new equation. Congress leaders are in contact with the PDP so that the
Government can be formed and on the other hand, leaders of the NC are communicating with the BJP. leaders of NC are trying to gain in both the situations;
if election is held, they are hopeful of regaining their base and if the election is not held, they are hopeful of gaining power with the BJP.
reference_summary:
Sonia Gandhi believes that Rahul Gandhi will only be taken seriously as Congress president when he officially takes charge, as current attention is focused on Nitish Kumar and Arvind Kejriwal. Meanwhile, Amit Shah continues routine organizational work for the BJP after being re-elected as president, with some state leaders expected to change but no immediate major shifts planned. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is evaluating departmental performance, with potential promotions for hardworking ministers, while also preparing for upcoming elections and the Budget Session.

Congress is worried that AAP could undermine its support in Punjab, Himachal, and Gujarat, even as AAP has supported Congress against the imposition of President’s rule in Arunachal Pradesh. Changes in Congress leadership are anticipated, with Rahul Gandhi indicating that he may make significant alterations before officially taking command. Speculations include replacing several General Secretaries and ensuring representation from OBC, Dalit, minority, and women communities.

In Jammu and Kashmir, discussions about pre-scheduled Assembly Elections are emerging, with National Conference and Congress appearing to shape the political landscape to their advantage. Both the PDP and BJP are reportedly reluctant to hold elections, fearing losses, while Congress and NC are exploring potential alliances for government formation.

[DOC 1] Swine flu claimed its first victim in Punjab this season with the death a 55-year-old woman, Sarabjit Kaur, in Amritsar on Tuesday. She succumbed to the disease after battling it for almost a week at Fortis Escorts Hospital.

Kaur was admitted to hospital with symptoms of the H1N1 virus on January 14, and her nasal and throat swab tests retuned positive for swine flu a day later. Kept in an isolation ward, her condition turned critical on January 19 as she was unable to breathe on her own and had to be put on ventilator. According to Dr Raju Chauhan, the district epidemiologist, the health department was informed of her death around 9.15am.

Dr Chauhan said that what had baffled the medical fraternity in the city was that she had no known history of travel to any area affected by swine flu or any interaction with suspected patients. However, he added that her kin had failed to provide proper information about her itinerary and interactions.“Four of her relatives reported symptoms of swine flu, but they were tested negative. They were administered precautionary treatment,” he said.

He added that a survey by the animal husbandry department had not traced any signs of the disease in the animals in Amritsar.

Neighbouring Haryana has seen four deaths from the flu this season.
reference_summary: A 55-year-old woman, Sarabjit Kaur, succumbed to swine flu in Amritsar, Punjab, after a week-long battle at Fortis Escorts Hospital. Admitted on January 14, her condition worsened, leading to ventilator support. Despite no travel history to affected areas, she tested positive. Four relatives with symptoms tested negative, and a survey found no signs of the disease in Amritsar's animals. Haryana recorded four swine flu deaths this season.

[DOC 1] In an effort to ensure cleanliness around the railway tracks, the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is conducting a special cleanliness drive in collaboration with Northern Railway. Under this, the Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) lying on both sides of the railway track is being cleared and disposed of scientifically.

 Giving details of the drive, officials said here on Wednesday the quantity of MSW lying on 105 km of railway track in Delhi was assessed as 31989 MT in June 2023 in a joint inspection by MCD and Railways.

Till November 15, 9106 MT waste was cleared. The detailed roadmap to remove the MSW lying along the railway track has been prepared in coordination with the Railways. As per this road map, the remaining 22883 MT MSW will be lifted up to March 31 next year, they said.

The work of lifting garbage from both sides of the railway tracks from Hazrat Nizamuddin to Lodhi Colony Station, from Lodhi Colony Station to Okhla Station, from Okhla Station to Badarpur Border Station and from Nizamuddin Station to Janata Camp Station is being done at a rapid pace by the Central Zone of MCD. This work would be completed by January 31.<At the same time, the garbage lying near the railway line from Bijwasan to Sagarpur flyover is being collected by Najafgarh zone and this work will be completed within a day or two.

The garbage lifting work from Shahdara Railway Station to Saboli Halt in Shahdara North zone will be completed by next month. The work of lifting garbage from Peeragarhi to Nangloi in the Rohini zone and from Azadpur to the Narela railway line in the Civil Line zone has almost been completed.The work of lifting MSW  from the railway line in the Keshav Puram zone, will be completed by January 31.

At the same time, in the Karol Bagh zone, the work of collecting garbage from both sides of Sarai Rohila to Patel Nagar, Zakhira Mandi to Patel Nagar and Patel Nagar to Kirti Nagar, Kirti Nagar to Naraina railway line is being done on priority basis and this work will be completed by March 2024.
reference_summary: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is conducting a special cleanliness drive in collaboration with Northern Railway to clear Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) from both sides of railway tracks in Delhi. Initially, 9106 MT of waste has been cleared out of 31989 MT assessed in June 2023. A detailed roadmap has been prepared to lift the remaining 22883 MT by March 31 next year. Different zones of MCD are assigned specific sections of railway tracks for cleanup, with completion dates ranging from January to March 2024. This initiative aims to ensure cleanliness and sanitation along the railway tracks in Delhi.

[DOC 1] ‘Drunken’ Mukesh crossed the barricade of the African lion enclosure at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad on Sunday despite warnings by the security staff.A 35-year-old “drunken” man jumped into a lion enclosure at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad on Sunday reportedly “to shake hand with a lion” but was rescued unhurt by the alert animal keeper.Mukesh, a native of Sikar district in Rajasthan, crossed the barricade of the African lion enclosure despite warnings by the security staff, Nehru Zoological Park Curator Shivani Dogra said.“The lioness (Radhika) was inside the enclosure but the person was rescued unhurt by its keeper R Papaiah,” the zoo officials said, adding the big cat had moved close to Mukesh but Papaiah diverted the lioness from him.
“After preliminary enquiry it was found that Mukesh was in an inebriated state and had jumped inside the enclosure to go near the lion. He has been handed over to Bahadurpura Police,” Dogra said.
Mukesh works as a labourer with L&T Metro Rail in Hyderabad.
When contacted, Bahadurpura Police Station Inspector Harish Kaushik said Mukesh jumped into the lion enclosure in an intoxicated condition and he will be booked on the charge of trespass under IPC.
“This kind of incident is creating fear among public, even after Nehru Zoological Park administration is trying its level best to make the zoo park a safe and secure place to visit,” Dogra said.

[DOC 2] ‘Drunken’ Mukesh crossed the barricade of the African lion enclosure at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad on Sunday despite warnings by the security staff.A 35-year-old “drunken” man jumped into a lion enclosure at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad on Sunday reportedly “to shake hand with a lion” but was rescued unhurt by the alert animal keeper.Mukesh, a native of Sikar district in Rajasthan, crossed the barricade of the African lion enclosure despite warnings by the security staff, Nehru Zoological Park Curator Shivani Dogra said.“The lioness (Radhika) was inside the enclosure but the person was rescued unhurt by its keeper R Papaiah,” the zoo officials said, adding the big cat had moved close to Mukesh but Papaiah diverted the lioness from him.
“After preliminary enquiry it was found that Mukesh was in an inebriated state and had jumped inside the enclosure to go near the lion. He has been handed over to Bahadurpura Police,” Dogra said.
Mukesh works as a labourer with L&T Metro Rail in Hyderabad.
When contacted, Bahadurpura Police Station Inspector Harish Kaushik said Mukesh jumped into the lion enclosure in an intoxicated condition and he will be booked on the charge of trespass under IPC.
“This kind of incident is creating fear among public, even after Nehru Zoological Park administration is trying its level best to make the zoo park a safe and secure place to visit,” Dogra said.
reference_summary: A 35-year-old man named Mukesh, reportedly intoxicated, jumped into the African lion enclosure at Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad on Sunday. Despite warnings from security staff, he crossed the barricade to purportedly shake hands with a lioness named Radhika. Alert zookeeper R. Papaiah managed to rescue Mukesh unharmed by diverting the lioness away from him. Mukesh, a laborer with L&T Metro Rail in Hyderabad, was handed over to Bahadurpura Police and faces charges of trespassing under the IPC. The incident has raised concerns about public safety at the zoo despite efforts by park authorities to ensure security.

[DOC 1] COLOMBO: At least 49 Indian fishermen have been arrested by Sri Lankan navy when they were fishing in the waters off the country's northern coastal areas.

Ten trawlers of the fishermen were also seized by the Sri Lanka Navy yesterday.

Sri Lankan Navy spokesman Kosala Warnakulasuriya said 49 fishermen had been arrested on two separate occasions off the northern coastal areas of Kankesanturai and Talaimannar.

While 24 of them were handed over to the Talaimannar police yesterday the rest of them were to be handed over to the Kankesanturai police on Thursday.

They will be produced in court and charged for violating Sri Lanka's international maritime border line, the Navy said.

The issue of fishermen continues to be thorny in the relations across the Palk Straits as the Sri Lankan Navy is often accused of harassing the TamilNadu fishermen.
reference_summary: Indian fishermen have been arrested by the Sri Lankan navy while fishing off the country's northern coast. Ten trawlers were also seized. The fishermen were arrested twice off Kankesanturai and Talaimannar, and will be charged for violating Sri Lanka's international maritime border line. The issue of fishermen remains thorny in relations across the Palk Straits.

[DOC 1] NEW DELHI: Panic gripped a Delhi government-run juvenile home at Mukherjee Nagar in northwest Delhi, as 28 of its inmates - aged between 8 and 11 years - escaped late on Tuesday night. While the police managed to trace 14 of them later, the others are still missing.

It was later found out that the boys had escaped by breaking open a window in one of the toilets. Sewa Kutir is home to 86 destitute children. On Tuesday night, at around 11 pm the boys, broke open one of the grill windows. They then escaped by scaling the walls.
The whereabouts of the supervisor and five security guards who were supposed to be present on the premises when the incident took place are not known.

By Wednesday evening, 14 of the kids were found. "They escaped in small groups, after they broke open the window using iron pipes. While some were brought back from Jahangirpuri and Civil Lines, others were found at the New Delhi railway station," said deputy commissioner of police (northwest) Sanjay Singh.


Singh further revealed that teams had been deployed at all railway stations to look for the children. The police are questioning the juvenile home staff to ascertain what led to the incident.

A public interest litigation (PIL) petition had been filed last year in the Delhi High Court, when 30 blind students in the same juvenile home fell ill after consuming food. It was alleged that the children were being subjected to shabby treatment, and that some of them did not return home after being released from the hospital. The petition had also claimed that the boys had been complaining about poor quality food and other facilities for the past several years, but to no avail.

In a similar incident on March 19 this year, 10 juveniles had escaped from the Observation Home for Boys, which is run by NGO Prayas, at Delhi Gate. These boys, all between 15 and 19 years old, were undertrials in cases of heinous crime.
reference_summary: Panic ensued at a Delhi government-run juvenile home in Mukherjee Nagar as 28 inmates, aged 8 to 11, escaped, but 14 were later traced by police. The boys broke a window and scaled walls to flee, while the whereabouts of staff remain unknown. Search teams located some children at railway stations. Investigations are ongoing, focusing on juvenile home staff. This incident follows a PIL last year alleging mistreatment of children at the home, including poor food quality and lack of facilities. In March, 10 older juveniles escaped from another facility run by NGO Prayas, raising concerns about security and welfare standards in Delhi's juvenile homes.

[DOC 1] MADURAI: The Madras high court has ordered notice to the registrar (general) of principal seat and registrar (administration) of the Madurai bench while hearing a batch of petitions, which challenged the newly-notified High Court of Madras (Conduct of Proceedings by Party-In-Person) Rules, 2019.

The petitions were filed by ‘Traffic’ Ramasamy, K K Ramesh and A M Sundaravel who appeared as party-in-persons in several cases.

The petitioners stated that registrar general of Madras high court has put in place new guidelines which were recently notified in the Rules. As per this notification, a person who wants to appear as party-in-person should file an application attested by oath commissioner or notary and the party-in-person committee would scrutinize the papers and take a decision on allowing the person to appear as party-in-person or would offer legal services through the high court legal services committee.
They stated that any litigant has the right to represent himself before the court, however, the newly notified rules attempts to strike out an individual representing himself before the court. They stated that compelling a litigant to engage a lawyer is not correct.
Since these new guidelines would cause several hardships for the people appearing as party-in-persons, the petitioners moved the high court Madurai bench challenging the newly-notified rules.


When the petition was heard on Wednesday, a division bench of justices M Duraiswamy and T Ravindran ordered notice and adjourned the case to a further date for hearing.
reference_summary: The Madras High Court has issued notices to the registrar (general) and registrar (administration) of its Madurai bench in response to petitions challenging the High Court of Madras (Conduct of Proceedings by Party-In-Person) Rules, 2019. Petitioners, including ‘Traffic’ Ramasamy, argued that the new rules, requiring party-in-person applicants to submit attested forms for scrutiny by a committee, restrict litigants' rights to self-representation and compel them to engage lawyers. They claimed this would create undue hardships for those appearing in person. A division bench, comprising Justices M. Duraiswamy and T. Ravindran, adjourned the hearing after issuing notices for further deliberation.

[DOC 1] Senior IPS officer, Amitabh Thakur, has sought permission from the State government to file Public Interest litigation (PIl) against them regarding rapid and frequent transfers of senior administrative officers and incharges of police stations. In his representation to Principal Secretary Home, dispatched on Wednesday,  Amitabh Thakur, presently posted as IG (Civil Defense) said that the State government itself passed two Government orders on 26 December 2010 fixing 2 years as minimum tenure of all police officers from Station Officer to DGP. Again after the Supreme Court order in TSR Subramaniam case, the Government of India amended the IAS, IPS Cadre Rules to make 2 years as the mandatory minimum tenure. 

He said that despite these legal provisions, these responsible officers are being transferred every day, leading to definite effect on governance. Thakur sought permission for filing PIl in compliance of an earlier High Court order which directed him to take first taken government’s permission than proceed with filing of PIl in the matter.

Meanwhile a PIl has been also filed in the lucknow bench of Allahabad High Cour by Charitable Trust Center for Civil liberties as regards complete apathy towards the recommendations sent by lokayukta to the State government against ex Ministers Nasimuddin, Ramveer Upadhyaya, Ratan lal Ahirwar, Swami Prasad Maurya etc and public servants like IAS Mahesh Gupta. 

Petitioner’s advocate Dr Nutan Thakur told that since 2011, lokayukta has sent Special reports to the Governor under section 12(5) of the lokayukta Act in 43 cases, where, as per section 12(7) of the Act, the action-taken report should have got placed before the State Assembly, which has been done in only 1 case. After the Governor directing the Chief Minister on 12 September 2014 and 27 April 2015, in 19 cases action has been taken but the report not placed before the Assembly. In 23 cases no action has been taken so far. As per Dr Thakur, the PIl seeks presenting the action-taken report in these 19 cases before the State Assembly definitely in the forthcoming session and also prays for directing the State government to necessarily take appropriate action in rest 23 cases within 01 month so as to place the action-taken report before the Assembly at the earliest.
reference_summary: IPS officer Amitabh Thakur has sought permission from the Uttar Pradesh state government to file a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) against the frequent and rapid transfers of senior administrative officers and police station in-charges. Thakur, currently serving as IG (Civil Defense), highlighted that the state government itself issued two orders in December 2010, establishing a minimum tenure of two years for police officers from Station Officer to DGP. Despite these legal provisions, responsible officers are being transferred daily, negatively impacting governance, Thakur noted. He is seeking permission to file the PIL in compliance with an earlier High Court order, which directed him to obtain government permission before proceeding. In a related matter, the charitable trust Center for Civil Liberties filed a PIL in the Lucknow bench of the Allahabad High Court, addressing the state government's apathy toward the Lokayukta's recommendations against former ministers and public servants.

[DOC 1] Amid intense lobbying, the US on Saturday denied it was trading favours while seeking votes of undecided countries for a new UN Security Council resolution paving way for military action against Iraq.
"There is nothing like trading favours. Sorry. We are only talking to everybody about their concerns, but this is for peace," National Security Council Advisor Condoleeza Rice told reporters here.
The denial comes in the wake of reports of Pakistan demanding implementation of the Security Council resolution on Kashmir, China asking for a stoppage of US sales of arms to Taiwan, and Mexico trying to extract some favours in exchange for a positive vote.
"We are still talking, of course, to the undecided countries. Sooner or later, the Security Council has got to act or not act and so it is time for the Security Council to resolve this," she said in rather vague response.
On what US was trying to communicate to the undecided six countries in the Security Council, Rice said, "we are trying to convey that there is a certain responsibility that comes with the Council membership, whether permanent or elected, and we are continuing to talk to people about that responsibility."
reference_summary: Amid intense lobbying for a new UN Security Council resolution on Iraq, the US denies trading favors. National Security Council Advisor Condoleezza Rice insists discussions focus on peace, refuting reports of favor exchanges with countries like Pakistan, China, and Mexico. While acknowledging ongoing talks with undecided Security Council members, Rice emphasizes the Council's responsibility to act decisively on Iraq. She underscores the importance of conveying this responsibility to all Council members, permanent or elected. The US stance reflects a commitment to seeking broad support for action while navigating complex diplomatic dynamics.

[DOC 1] ALPAIGURI: Union minister for environment and forests Jairam Ramesh, while equating the death of seven elephants in the Dooars on September 22 to the 1984 Bhopal Gas Tragedy, insisted on Friday that the night-running of freight and long-distance "through" trains along the 168-km stretch between New Jalpaiguri and Alipurduar should stop with immediate effect.
The minister, who toured Moraghat where the elephants were mowed down by a goods train on foot, was taken aback when he came to know that the pachyderms were not together when they were "slaughtered". The train driver did not bother to stop or slow down after knocking down one elephant. He seems to have proceeded unperturbed and killed six more.
"At what speed was this train travelling? I am meeting railway minister Mamata Banerjee next week. Night-running of goods and non-stop express trains should stop along this stretch. Of the 27 elephants that have been mowed down by trains in the last seven years since the tracks were converted to broad gauge 23 have been killed during the night. The latest deaths were similar to what happened in Bhopal," Ramesh said.
Locals and NGOs organized a protest during Ramesh's visit and also raised accusing fingers at the Bengal forest department. State forest minister Ananta Roy had already been targeted by organizations like Adivasi Vikas Parishad when he turned up at the spot during the day. Environment activists and locals pointed out to Ramesh that Roy had not found time to visit the area, in spite of the tragedy, though he belongs to nearby Cooch Behar.
The forest department has identified 44 spots between New Jalpaiguri and Alipurduar Jn where elephants and other wild animals are prone to crossing the railway tracks. While 20 of these are within the forest, the remaining are on the fringes. Till now, the railways has imposed speed restrictions along a 30-km stretch. Forest department
officials believe that trains should not run at a speed of over 25-30 kmph along the entire stretch.
"It is not possible to determine the exact location from where an elephant herd will emerge and attempt to cross the tracks. The railways needs to be aware of the situation. More so as we are on our way to setting up the national elephant conservation authority. The railways will have to take steps for doubling of the tracks between New Jalpaiguri and New Alipurduar. A number of trains can then be diverted," Ramesh said.
The doubling will cost nearly `600 crore and sources revealed that the railway ministry is seriously contemplating taking it up. The state forest department has proposed to set up 10 control towers along the train route that passes through the forests of Buxa, Jaldapara, Chapramari, Apalchand and Mahananda, apart from several fragmented forested areas.
Roy announced that the state finance department had already cleared the appointment of 550 forest guards. Bonbondhu groups on the lines of those set up around the Sunderbans would also be set up, consisting of volunteers
reference_summary: Union Minister Jairam Ramesh likened the death of seven elephants in Dooars to the Bhopal Gas Tragedy, urging the immediate cessation of night-running freight and long-distance trains between New Jalpaiguri and Alipurduar. Ramesh emphasized the need for speed restrictions along the tracks and proposed doubling the railway lines, costing approximately ₹600 crore. Locals and NGOs protested during Ramesh's visit, accusing the Bengal forest department of negligence. State forest minister Ananta Roy faced criticism for not visiting the site promptly. The forest department proposed setting up control towers and appointing forest guards to mitigate further incidents.

input_text: [DOC 1] Chennai: All is not well with the city’s 140-odd Urban Health and Wellness Centres (UHWCs), built at a cost of Rs 88 crore and unveiled by Chief Minister M K Stalin three months ago with much fanfare.Funded under the Centre’s Ayushman Bharat scheme, these wellness centres were conceived to complement the immensely popular urban public health centres (UPHCs) in quality healthcare service delivery in city.New buildings, built deep inside residential localities, were supposed to have a doctor, a paramedic and a nurse, offering about 20 services including laboratory for blood tests, neonatal and pregnancy care, cancer screening and non-communicable diseases testing. UHWC guidelines say these centres should offer care for ENT, mental health issues and basic oral health.However, during spot-check TOI found that there were halls and rooms, and little else. There were no screening devices nor furniture for medical professionals or record-keeping. Many of these centres were hardly equipped to offer the designated services. The Manali UHWC had a table for the doctor in the waiting room, while the remaining three rooms were totally empty. Lab services were yet to operate and none of the major equipment like screening devices, IV facility and glucometres had arrived. There was no laboratory sink too.At West Mambalam, all the three rooms on the first floor were empty and were bging used as storerooms. Dr Dharshini said the unit needed an ultrasound machine for pregnancy screening, besides more beds in the rooms. “People lack awareness about these centres. Since there are bigger hospitals in the vicinity offering more facilities, they go there,” said the doctor.At the Santhome centre, there was no separate pharmacy room, and all the medicine were found stacked inside the patient’s room itself.Finding doctors is the bigger problem, as services here are available only on contract basis with little long-term career prospects. Many of them quit soon after joining, said a doctor from Teynampet zone said. The work hours too are odd. “Both urban primary centres and the UHWCs open at 8am. But UHWCs close at noon and reopen at 4pm. Doctors have nowhere else to go and nothing else to do during this strange four-hour break time,” said the doctor.A Ramalingam, state general secretary of PG Service Doctors Associations, said both UHWCs and UPHCs should be taken over by the state health department, as in the case of districts. “If the state recruits doctors on permanent basis, they will be assured of a career and research growth internally. It will be an incentive for medical professionals to stay on and contribute to the success of such initiatives,” he said.Former director of public health Dr K Kolandasamy said only if these centres are armed with cancer screening machines, oral detection kits, pregnancy care and NCD testing, major hospitals will get unburdened. “A patient would need a specialist doctor for the first check up, but a UHWC doctor would do for follow-ups. For this, the doctor should be trained to read specialty doctors’ reports and necessary supportive equipment should be there,” he said.When contacted, GCC commissioner Dr J Radhakrishnan said as UWHC is a good concept meant to provide ancillary care to people. “We are working on to create awareness about these centres and funding proposals are being given to address the gaps,” he said.Explore Your Financial Landscape with Personalized Credit Insights.
reference_summary: Chennai's 140 Urban Health and Wellness Centres (UHWCs), built at a cost of Rs 88 crore, are facing challenges in delivering quality healthcare services. Despite being equipped with new buildings and promised services, many centers lack screening devices, furniture, and essential equipment. Staffing is also a concern, with doctors working on contracts with limited career prospects, leading to high turnover. Doctors also face odd working hours, while the centers struggle to create awareness among the public. Experts suggest that the state health department should take over the centers and recruit doctors on a permanent basis to ensure better care and continuity of services.

[DOC 1] Germany's Olaf Scholz government has said that it will spend €200 billion to tackle the high costs of gas, which is needed to generate power, heat homes and other purposes. The objective would be to help the consumers withstand the high costs and encourage businesses to cope with high energy prices.

The government announced on Thursday that money would be infused into the economy by injecting €200 billion. The war in Ukraine has led to a situation where Russian energy prices have shot up, and Germany has to reinvest into the economy to help the people fight the high prices.

The government's pitch to the citizens is that help will come through the "defensive shield." During the global recession and the Covid pandemic, the German government used the "defensive shield" to create a cushion for ordinary citizens.Gas is an essential commodity in Germany, and it is used to heat homes during winter, produce electricity and help provide power to factories.

The government had earlier planned to levy a surcharge on the citizens to bring down the rising cost of purchasing fuel on the global market, but it is now being scrapped.

Instead of the surcharge, the government would pump €200 billion. This investment  is Germany's idea of fighting back against Russia. Germany won't be cutting taxes like the UK and weakening the currency in the bargain.
reference_summary: Germany's Olaf Scholz government allocates €200 billion to tackle soaring gas prices triggered by the Ukraine war's impact on Russian energy costs. Termed a "defensive shield," this injection aims to aid consumers and businesses combatting high energy expenses. Gas, pivotal for heating homes, electricity, and industry, necessitates this financial boost. Scrapping a planned citizen surcharge, the government opts for the €200 billion investment instead, aiming to counter Russia's impact without tax cuts or currency devaluation, distinguishing its strategy from the UK's approach amid the crisis.

[DOC 1] In an unfavourable turn of events, inflation measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI) was at 3.65% year-on-year in August, up from 3.60% in July, and surpassing Mint 's consensus estimate of 3.5%. Given the generous rainfall seen in August, expectations were that retail inflation would moderate as vegetable prices ease.

The unexpected uptick was largely driven by higher-than-expected food inflation, while core inflation remained benign.

“We believe that higher food price inflation is a statistical issue. Until July, food prices were higher. Now, although food prices are falling, it is not being reflected in the CPI data," pointed out a Nomura Global Markets Research report dated 13 September.

More here | August inflation: What CPI data tells us beyond the base effect, in charts

The critical question now is how this affects the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) anticipated timeline for interest rate cuts. The August CPI reading reduces the probability of an October rate cut to about 60%, down from 70% prior to the release, according to the Nomura report.

The RBI's next policy meeting, scheduled for 7-9 October, will take place after the September inflation figures are released. The weather department has forecast above-normal rainfall for September, and the development of La Niña conditions towards the month's end will be crucial for the monsoon's withdrawal. While headline CPI inflation remains below the RBI’s 4% target, news regarding food prices remains concerning.

Read this | Food vs core inflation: No, RBI's rate policy doesn’t need a new playbook

“Daily retail prices indicate pick-up in food prices (on a month-on-month basis) in September. This is based on prices for the first two weeks," said an IDFC First Bank report dated 12 September.

While the price trend for vegetables is mixed, those of cereals and pulses continue to decline, but the pace has reduced, added IDFC whose preliminary estimate for September CPI is 5.1%, after building-in a small month-on-month rise in food prices. Thankfully, easing global crude oil prices could provide some cushion to energy inflation.

But that’s not all. There is another important development that needs to be monitored and could weigh on RBI’s decision on interest rate. “The four-year term of the three external members in the monetary policy committee concludes next month and new members might be named ahead of the October rate review," Radhika Rao, senior economist and executive director at DBS Bank, Singapore, said in a note.

Interestingly, latest RBI meeting minutes show that two of the existing external members in the Monetary Policy Committee are in favour of cuts versus the majority whose decision is to hold on rates. “Incoming members might prefer to maintain the status quo in October but follow a broader MPC shift in December as more inflation and growth prints become available," Rao added.

The RBI has kept key policy rates unchanged for more than 18 months now.

On the global front, the European Central Bank lowered its deposit rate by 25 basis points to 3.50%, in line with expectations. Attention now turns to the US Federal Reserve, which is set to meet on 17-18 September. The Fed is expected to begin its monetary policy easing cycle with a 25 basis point rate cut. One basis point equals one-hundredth of a percentage point.
reference_summary: Consumer Price Index (CPI) was at 3.65% year-on-year in August, surpassing Mint's consensus estimate' The August CPI reading reduces the probability of an October rate cut to about 60%, down from 70% prior to the release, according to a Nomura report.

[DOC 1] NEW DELHI: Over 63.47 lakh income tax returns were filed till 10 pm on Sunday, the last day for filing ITR for the 2021-22 fiscal by salaried individuals, the Income Tax department said.
The deadline for filing I-T returns by those taxpayers who do not have to get their accounts audited for the fiscal that ended on March 31, 2022 was Sunday.
Till July 30, more than 5.1 crore tax returns were filed.Taking the 63.47 lakh returns filed on the last day, the total number of ITRs for the 2021-22 fiscal filed till 10 pm went past 5.73 crore.
ITR filing will go on till midnight, after which the tax-return filers will have to pay a late fee for delayed filing.
Giving statistics of the Income Tax Returns (ITR) filed on Sunday, the I-T department tweeted: "63,47,054 #ITRs have been filed up to 2200 hours today and 4,60,496 #ITRs filed in the last 1 hr."
In the last fiscal (2020-21), about 5.89 crore ITRs were filed by the extended due date of December 31, 2021.
Over the last one month, the I-T department has been nudging the taxpayers to file their ITRs for the 2021-22 fiscal to avoid the levy of the late fee.
The department had also asked the taxpayers to seek assistance regarding ITR filing by sending e-mails to orm@cpc.incometax.gov.in or calling help desk numbers 1800 103 0025 and 1800 419 0025.
According to tax laws, a late fee of Rs 5,000 would be payable by those with an annual income of over Rs 5 lakh, if they file their ITR by December 31 of the assessment year.
Individuals with an annual income of below Rs 5 lakh will be liable to pay a late fee of Rs 1,000 for delayed return filing.
reference_summary: Over 63.47 lakh income tax returns were filed till 10 pm on Sunday, marking the last day for filing ITR for the 2021-22 fiscal by salaried individuals, according to the Income Tax department. The total number of ITRs for the 2021-22 fiscal filed till 10 pm surpassed 5.73 crore, including the 63.47 lakh returns filed on the last day. The deadline for filing I-T returns by those who do not have to get their accounts audited for the fiscal ending March 31, 2022, was Sunday. The ITR filing will continue until midnight, with a late fee applicable for delayed filing thereafter.

In the ever-evolving landscape of education, nurturing critical thinking skills has become paramount for preparing students to navigate a complex world. In the realm of education, the cultivation of sharp minds takes centre stage.

Cultivating sharp minds goes beyond traditional rote learning; it entails fostering an environment that encourages inquiry, analysis, and independent thought. This dynamic curriculum places a strong emphasis on not just absorbing information, but on cultivating critical thinking skills that empower students to engage with knowledge in a profound and transformative way.

Let’s explore five effective approaches aimed at equipping learners with the intellectual tools necessary to tackle challenges, make informed decisions, and flourish as analytical thinkers in an increasingly dynamic global society.
Encourage Questioning
Fostering a culture of questioning plays a pivotal role in nurturing critical thinking, curiosity and a deeper understanding of the subjects.
This approach is designed to pique their curiosity, spark interest, and ignite a genuine passion for learning. By actively engaging with the material through questioning, students take ownership of their education.
reference_summary: Encouraging students to ask questions is crucial for fostering critical thinking in education. The ever-evolving educational landscape emphasizes the importance of cultivating sharp minds, moving beyond traditional rote learning to promote inquiry, analysis, and independent thought. A dynamic curriculum places a strong emphasis on developing critical thinking skills, empowering students to engage with knowledge profoundly. Five effective approaches include fostering a culture of questioning, sparking curiosity, and igniting a passion for learning. These strategies aim to equip learners with intellectual tools to tackle challenges, make informed decisions, and thrive as analytical thinkers in a dynamic global society.

[DOC 1] With an aim to simplify revenue records so that benefits could reach farmers directly Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav has formed a committee that would suggest new laws after consultation with advocates and people associated with revenue department. The committee would be headed by Additional Advocate General Raj Bahadur Singh.
 
 Yadav said this committee will hold consultation with advocates dealing in revenue cases, advocate associations and even lekhpals to take suggestions as who to improve delivery system. “The state government wants that all revenue related cases should be solved in a transparent manner. We want that farmers should get the benefit of Government schemes because they are the real stake holders. Therefore, Government wants that all nre revenue related rules should be formulated after due consultation with people,” Chief Minister said.
 
 Government spokesman said that suggestions have also been sought from the common man. Willing people mail their suggestions to rbsingyadav11@gmail.com or bharatyadav1507@gmail.com by May 12.
reference_summary: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav has established a committee aimed at simplifying revenue records to ensure that benefits reach farmers directly. The committee, led by Additional Advocate General Raj Bahadur Singh, will work on proposing new laws after consulting with advocates and individuals associated with the revenue department. The goal is to improve the transparency and efficiency of revenue-related cases and ensure that farmers receive the benefits of government schemes. Suggestions from the public are also being sought to aid in the formulation of new rules.

[DOC 1] Break- up puts Valley on course for fiercest battle for power in decades

SANKARSHAN THAKUR New Delhi, July 20: The stage is being set for the most prickly battle for power in Jammu and Kashmir in decades. Not least because the ruling allies â€” the National Conference ( NC) and the Congress â€” formally parted ways today, bickering even about who was the first to flash divorce documents.

The lame duck alliance remains in power for the while but the partners are now in open slugfest ahead of Assembly elections due in October- November.

The Congress announced today it would contest all 87 Assembly seats on its own, calling curtains on the six- year power alliance. But Jammu and Kashmir chief minister and NC chief Omar Abdullah moved swiftly to claim he was the first to pull the plug on it 10 days ago.

His decision to go it alone in the forthcoming Assembly polls was spelt out in a private meeting with Congress president Sonia Gandhi 10 days ahead of the Congress's announcement, Omar said.

Omar's NC, too, intends fielding candidates in all Assembly segments, rendering the contest multi- cornered and potentially the keenest in recent memory. Other contenders for power in J& K include the Modi- fired BJP and Mufti Mohammed Sayeed's People's Democratic Party ( PDP).

Since 2002, the PDP and the NC have taken turns to rule the state with coalitions.

The Congress has been part of both ruling dispensations ( with PDP in 2002- 2008; with NC in 2008- 2014) and even had a spell in the hot seat when Ghulam Nabi Azad took over reins from the Mufti as part of an internal power- share agreement.

( Jammu and Kashmir is the only Indian state mandated to six- year Assembly terms.) Shortly upon the announcement from Ambika Soni of the Congress today, Omar put out a tweet saying it was the NC that had decided to part ways.
reference_summary: The political landscape in Jammu and Kashmir is set for a fierce battle as the National Conference (NC) and Congress formally ended their six-year alliance, each claiming to have initiated the split. The Congress announced it would contest all 87 Assembly seats independently, while Chief Minister Omar Abdullah of the NC asserted he had decided to break the alliance 10 days earlier. Both parties plan to field candidates in all constituencies, making the upcoming October-November Assembly elections highly competitive. Other major contenders include the BJP, energized by Narendra Modi, and Mufti Mohammed Sayeed's People's Democratic Party (PDP). Since 2002, the PDP and NC have alternated in power through coalitions, with Congress participating in both administrations.

[DOC 1] Effective implementation of panchayat raj and municipal acts is a must to bring qualitative change in the development of villages and towns, Chief Minister K. Chandrasekhar Rao has said. He also stressed the need to make the acts people-friendly to ensure good governance.

The Chief Minister made these observations at a review meeting held here on Monday on strengthening the panchayat raj act, preparing an action plan for its effective implementation and formulating a new municipal act.

Ministers Errabelli Dayakar Rao, Koppula Eshwar, V. Srinivas Goud, Chief Advisor to Government Rajiv Sharma, Principal Secretaries S. Narsing Rao (CMO), Arvind Kumar (Municipal Administration) and others attended the meeting.

Speaking at the meeting the Chief Minister underscored the need to formulate a new municipal act, on the lines of panchayat raj act, with transparency and without giving scope for corruption.

An effective action plan for the all round development and welfare of villages and towns would make the task easy for officials and elected representatives, provided they discharge their functions with commitment.

Stating that there was scope for development of villages on par with towns, he suggested the officials and elected representatives to be responsible and responsive in providing basic infrastructure and other facilities. “We have to understand that people are expecting good governance and improved services,” the Chief Minister said adding that a proper municipal act was prepared.

Legislators Palla Rajeshwar Reddy, Aroori Ramesh, Commissioner of Municipal Administration T.K. Sridevi, Special Secretary in CMO Bhoopal Reddy and others also participated.
reference_summary:
Chief Minister K. Chandrasekhar Rao emphasized the importance of effectively implementing panchayat raj and municipal acts to bring significant development to villages and towns in a recent review meeting. He stressed the necessity of ensuring these acts are people-friendly to promote good governance. The meeting focused on strengthening the panchayat raj act, devising an action plan for its implementation, and creating a new municipal act.

KCR highlighted the need for a transparent municipal act devoid of corruption, similar to the panchayat raj act. He emphasized that officials and elected representatives must fulfill their roles with dedication for the holistic development and welfare of villages and towns. KCR urged them to provide essential infrastructure and facilities responsibly, stating that there is potential for villages to develop on par with towns. He stressed the public's expectation of good governance and improved services, emphasizing the significance of a well-structured municipal act.

The meeting was attended by key officials, ministers, and legislators, including Palla Rajeshwar Reddy and Aroori Ramesh, discussing strategies to enhance rural and urban development while ensuring effective governance and improved services.

[DOC 1] Vadodara: Karjan police booked five persons from Uttar Pradesh in connection with the death of a painting contractor in September last year.
After the deceased Amit Singh died late on September 29, the five accused – Ravindra Singh alias Bunty Rajput, Prem Singh Rajavat, Dharmendra Singh alias Rinku Rajput, Jaiveer Singh alias Chachu Bhadoriya and Raju Singh Parihar – told the police that Singh died after falling from terrace. The police had registered a case of accidental death then.
However, post-mortem and forensic experts confirmed that Singh died of strangulation and the police registered a new FIR on Monday on the basis of complaint of given by Satishkumar Katheriya, a painter who worked under Singh.
Katheriya told the police that on September 29, after finishing their work, he and two other painters, who worked under Singh, returned to their rented home at Nava Bazaar in Karjan town. Around 10.30 pm Singh reached home and was talking to somebody on phone. After about half an hour, the five accused came there and asked Singh to go with them as they wanted to talk with him. Singh told Katheriya and other two painters to go to sleep as he will return late.


The complaint stated that Katheriya woke up at around 3.30 am when he heard commotion in the house. The five accused had brought Singh in unconscious state and told Katheriya that Singh has passed out as he had consumed lot of liquor. But when Katheriya checked, Singh was not breathing. He also noticed injury marks over his throat and when he asked about it, Bunty threatened him with life to not ask or tell anyone about the events of that night.

Later, the accused called ambulance to take Singh’s body to hospital and even called police. When the doctor in the ambulance declared Singh dead, his body was taken for post-mortem. The accused then told the police that Singh fell from the terrace following which a case of accidental death was registered. After the incident, Katheriya returned to his village in Uttar Pradesh, but after the reports arrived cops called him to Karjan to record his statement.


Police suspect that Singh was killed over business enmity between him and the five accused as they too were involved in similar work like him. No arrests have been made yet.
reference_summary: Five individuals from Uttar Pradesh are booked in Vadodara for the death of painting contractor Amit Singh. Initially declared accidental, Singh's post-mortem revealed strangulation. Complainant Satishkumar Katheriya, a painter under Singh, reported that the accused brought Singh unconscious, claiming alcohol consumption. Threatened by the accused, Katheriya disclosed the events. Police suspect business rivalry as a motive. No arrests have been made.

[DOC 1] Former Congress mayor Sampath Raj was sent to judicial custody for 14 days by a Bengaluru court on Friday, Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime) Sandeep Patil confirmed.

Raj was arrested on Monday night by the Central Crime Branch (CCB) of the Bengaluru City Police for instigating violence in parts of the city, allegedly after a derogatory social media post appeared online.

While he was sent to police custody initially, till Friday, he was produced before the court which ordered judicial custody. The investigating team said it has gathered “crucial information” about his role in the arson orchestrated at Congress MLA Akhanda Srinivasa Murthy's residence in Kaval Byrasandra on August 11. "We have interrogated him thoroughly and had taken him for inspection at few places linked to the case," an officer said.
reference_summary: Former Congress mayor Sampath Raj was sent to judicial custody for 14 days by a Bengaluru court after his arrest for allegedly instigating violence following a derogatory social media post. The police gathered crucial information linking him to the August 11 arson at Congress MLA Akhanda Srinivasa Murthy's residence.

input_text: [DOC 1] The Assam movement leaders disclosed a fresh and angry confrontation programme of action, including a statewide 24-hour bandh on December 2, to counteract what they called, a “conspiratorial election” without solving the foreigners issue. The movement leaders also expressed their reservation on attending the projected New Delhi talks scheduled for December 6. They said the anti-infiltration steps taken up by the Centre were a “sham and an eyewash.”
reference_summary:
Summary:
Leaders of the Assam movement announced a new and assertive action plan, including a statewide 24-hour bandh on December 2, to protest against what they perceived as a "conspiratorial election" without addressing the foreigners issue. They also voiced skepticism about attending planned talks in New Delhi on December 6, criticizing the anti-infiltration measures by the Centre as inadequate.

[DOC 1] The year 2016 has started on a busy note for the pretty Shraddha Kapoor. Close on the heels of a top filmmaker announcing her name for a romantic film with her ex-boyfriend Aditya Roy Kapur, hit filmmaker Mohit Suri (of ‘Aashiqui 2’ and ‘Ek Villain’ fame) has signed the petite actress for ‘Half Girlfriend’.

The film is based on Chetan Bhagat’s coming-of-age novel of the same name. There are three interesting aspects about this project. This is Shraddha’s third film with Mohit. This is her second movie that is adapted from a book, the earlier one being ‘Haider’. And this is the first time she will play an affluent Delhi-based girl.
The actress was unavailable for comment but a source indicated that Shraddha is super excited about the development and has signed on the dotted line
reference_summary: Shraddha Kapoor has a busy start to 2016, with filmmaker Mohit Suri signing her for the film "Half Girlfriend," based on Chetan Bhagat's novel. This marks Shraddha's third collaboration with Mohit Suri, and she's excited about playing an affluent Delhi-based girl. This comes shortly after another top filmmaker announced her involvement in a romantic film with her ex-boyfriend Aditya Roy Kapur. The actress had previously worked in another film adapted from a book, "Haider." While Shraddha was unavailable for comment, sources indicate her enthusiasm about the project.
